metadata.title: CVE-2021-31215 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
SchedMD Slurm before 20.02.7 and 20.03.x through 20.11.x before 20.11.7allows remote code execution as SlurmUser because use of a PrologSlurmctldor EpilogSlurmctld script leads to environment mishandling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 21.08.5
libpam-slurm-adopt - 21.08.5
libpmi0 - 21.08.5
libpmi2-0 - 21.08.5
libslurm-perl - 21.08.5
libslurm36 - 21.08.5
libslurmdb-perl - 21.08.5
slurm-client - 21.08.5
slurm-client-emulator - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-emulator - 21.08.5
slurm-wlm-torque - 21.08.5
slurmctld - 21.08.5
slurmd - 21.08.5
slurmdbd - 21.08.5
slurmrestd - 21.08.5
sview - 21.08.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-wlm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '21.08.5').
